summary: Internal FBI email chain discussing the urgent need to digitize and transfer documents from the FBI's West Palm Beach investigation of Jeffrey Epstein to the Southern District of New York (SDNY) in preparation for his imminent indictment and arrest. The emails reveal coordination between FBI field offices and headquarters regarding document sharing procedures.

events.title: Planned Indictment of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The SDNY planned to indict Jeffrey Epstein on Tuesday, July 2, 2019, with the arrest date contingent on his travel back into the United States.

events.title: Meeting with SDNY Chief of Criminal
events.description: A meeting was held with the SDNY Chief of Criminal to discuss concerns about document transfer and the potential need to escalate the matter.

keyFacts: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) planned to indict Jeffrey Epstein on Tuesday, July 2, 2019, and was preparing for his arrest upon his return to the US.
There was an urgent need to digitize and transfer documents from the FBI's West Palm Beach (WPBRA) investigation of Epstein to SDNY to prepare for a potential expedited trial.
The FBI's Office of General Counsel (OGC) was consulted, and an attorney was expected to reach out to discuss the matter further.
SDNY had a contractor regularly used to scan documents for discovery, a process the New York FBI field office had utilized with them in the past.
The email chain indicates internal FBI coordination and a desire to avoid formal escalation from SDNY regarding the document transfer.
